data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.

abilities.name: Sky Circus
abilities.text: If you played Bird Keeper from your hand during this turn, ignore all Energy in this Pokémon's attack costs.

attacks.name: Wind Shard
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dartrix
data.flavorText: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.

data.name: Blipbug
data.flavorText: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

data.name: Applin
data.flavorText: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.name: Centiskorch
data.flavorText: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

attacks.name: Hundred Foot Flames
attacks.text: For each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Suicune
data.flavorText: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

attacks.name: Aurora Loop
attacks.text: Put 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Sobble
data.flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

data.name: Drizzile
data.flavorText: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

abilities.name: Shady Dealings
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Inteleon
data.flavorText: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

abilities.name: Shady Dealings
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Aqua Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Rillaboom
data.flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

abilities.name: Voltage Beat
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Dottler
data.flavorText: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

attacks.name: Reflect
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Scorbunny
data.flavorText: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it's raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.

attacks.name: Reflect
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Galarian Mr. Rime
data.flavorText: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

abilities.name: Shuffle Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's face-down Prize cards with the top card of their deck. (The cards stay face down.)

attacks.name: Mad Party
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the Mad Party attack.

data.name: Galarian Darmanitan
data.flavorText: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Crushing Headbutt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Crushing Headbutt.

data.name: Arrokuda
data.flavorText: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.

data.name: Arctovish
data.flavorText: Though it's able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

attacks.name: Hard Face
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 60 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Grookey
data.flavorText: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Thwackey
data.flavorText: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

abilities.name: Lay of the Land
abilities.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Orbeetle
data.flavorText: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what's around it—and what's around it can include things over six miles away.

abilities.name: Bug's Radar
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Brainwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Eldegoss
data.flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

attacks.name: Blessing of Fluff
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Raboot
data.flavorText: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Sizzlipede
data.flavorText: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

data.name: Snom
data.flavorText: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Eiscue
data.flavorText: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.

abilities.name: Ice Face
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP, it takes 60 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dracovish
data.flavorText: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

abilities.name: Primal Law
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't play any Pokémon from their hand to evolve their Pokémon.

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: One boy's invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotom's unique capabilities.

abilities.name: Roto Choice
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Item cards that have the word "Rotom" in their name, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Yamper
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Boltund
data.flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Fighting Fangs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V or Pokémon-GX, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Decidueye
data.flavorText: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye's shots never miss.

abilities.name: Deep Forest Camo
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX.

attacks.name: Splitting Arrow
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gossifleur
data.flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Flapple
data.flavorText: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

abilities.name: Apple Drop
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Appletun
data.flavorText: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.

abilities.name: Delicious Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Cinderace
data.flavorText: It's skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

abilities.name: Libero
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may attach up to 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to it.

attacks.name: Flare Striker
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Darumaka
data.flavorText: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.

attacks.name: Ice Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Chewtle
data.flavorText: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

data.name: Drednaw
data.flavorText: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

attacks.name: Vise Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Jaw Lock
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Cramorant
data.flavorText: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Barraskewda
data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

attacks.name: Spiral Jet
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. If you don't, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Frosmoth
data.flavorText: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

abilities.name: Ice Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.

data.name: Pincurchin
data.flavorText: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

attacks.name: Shocking Needles
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. If at least 2 of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Hatterene
data.flavorText: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.

abilities.name: Mind Hat
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Each player discards a card from their hand. (Your opponent discards first.)

attacks.name: Dripping Grudge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Milcery
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Alcremie
data.flavorText: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.

attacks.name: Decorate
attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Indeedee
data.flavorText: These intelligent Pokémon touch horns with each other to share information between them.

attacks.name: Replenish Time
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Morpeko
data.flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Galarian Yamask
data.flavorText: A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask's dark power.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Rolycoly
data.flavorText: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

data.name: Carkol
data.flavorText: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

data.name: Galarian Ponyta
data.flavorText: This Pokémon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Coalossal
data.flavorText: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Tar Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Fire Energy card, a Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Silicobra
data.flavorText: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Galarian Rapidash
data.flavorText: Brave and prideful, this Pokémon dashes airily through the forest, its steps aided by the psychic power stored in the fur on its fetlocks.

abilities.name: Pastel Veil
abilities.text: Your Pokémon recover from all Special Conditions and can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Clobbopus
data.flavorText: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Galarian Cursola
data.flavorText: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon's core spirit.

abilities.name: Perish Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Grapploct
data.flavorText: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

attacks.name: Octolock
attacks.text: Until this Grapploct leaves the Active Spot, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorless more, and the Defending Pokémon can't retreat. This effect can't be applied more than once.

attacks.name: Tough Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Stonjourner
data.flavorText: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun's descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Galarian Zigzagoon
data.flavorText: Thought to be the oldest form of Zigzagoon, it moves in zigzags and wreaks havoc upon its surroundings.

abilities.name: Headbutt Tantrum
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Galarian Obstagoon
data.flavorText: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

abilities.name: Untamed Shout
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Obstruct
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.name: Nickit
data.flavorText: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

attacks.name: Instigate
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If they put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, they draw 3 cards.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker
data.flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

abilities.name: Steely Spirit
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Cufant
data.flavorText: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It's also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

data.name: Impidimp
data.flavorText: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

data.name: Copperajah
data.flavorText: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.

abilities.name: Antibacterial Skin
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Vengeful Stomp
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Duraludon
data.flavorText: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

attacks.name: Metal Sharpener
attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Minccino
data.flavorText: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

attacks.name: Glance
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Oranguru
data.flavorText: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.

abilities.name: Primate Wisdom
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch a card from your hand with the top card of your deck.

data.name: Charizard VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Wildfire
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Skwovet
data.flavorText: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.

data.name: Falinks V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Iron Defense Formation
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon that have "Falinks" in their name take 20 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Rillaboom V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Forest Feast
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Grass Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Grimmsnarl VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Drill
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each extra Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon (in addition to this attack's cost). You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

data.name: Centiskorch V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Radiating Heat
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lapras VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Toxtricity V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Electric Riot
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Grimmsnarl V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spiky Knuckle
attacks.text: Put 2 Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Ditto VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Transform
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Dubwool V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Soft Wool
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Toxel
data.flavorText: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.

data.name: Toxtricity
data.flavorText: When this Pokémon sounds as if it's strumming a guitar, it's actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.

attacks.name: Risk Taker
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck. If tails, discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Galarian Corsola
data.flavorText: Watch your step when wandering areas oceans once covered. What looks like a stone could be this Pokémon, and it will curse you if you kick it.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Dedenne
data.flavorText: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.

attacks.name: Mad Party
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the Mad Party attack.

data.name: Sinistea
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.

attacks.name: Furtive Drop
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Hatenna
data.flavorText: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Hattrem
data.flavorText: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brutal Swing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Dreepy
data.flavorText: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Drakloak
data.flavorText: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

attacks.name: Summon
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Dreepy and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Galarian Sirfetch'd
data.flavorText: Only Farfetch'd that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon's leek withers, it will retire from combat.

attacks.name: Meteor Assault
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Meteor Assault again until it leaves the Active Spot.

data.name: Sandaconda
data.flavorText: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.

attacks.name: Coil
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Falinks
data.flavorText: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass's orders are absolute.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Team Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has "Falinks" in its name.

data.name: Galarian Linoone
data.flavorText: This very aggressive Pokémon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.

attacks.name: Night Slash
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Grimmsnarl
data.flavorText: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.

abilities.name: Dark Oath
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Meowth
data.flavorText: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

abilities.name: Evolution Roar
abilities.text: You must discard 2 cards from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Galarian Perrserker, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Galarian Stunfisk
data.flavorText: Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.

abilities.name: Snap Trap
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if it is Knocked Out), discard an Energy from the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Damage Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Corviknight
data.flavorText: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.

attacks.name: Iron Wings
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, during your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

data.name: Greedent
data.flavorText: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn't notice the loss.

abilities.name: Greedy Tail
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Rookidee
data.flavorText: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

data.name: Wooloo
data.flavorText: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won't be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Centiskorch VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Centiferno
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you did any damage with this attack, you may attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Lapras V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Body Surf
attacks.text: Attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ocean Loop
attacks.text: Put 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Toxtricity VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Riot
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Ditto V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: V Transformation
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may choose a Basic Pokémon V from your discard pile and switch it with this Pokémon. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stick On
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Eternatus V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Power Accelerator
attacks.text: You may attach a Darkness Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamax Cannon
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Eternatus VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Eternal Zone
abilities.text: If all of your Pokémon in play are Darkness type, you can have up to 8 Pokémon on your Bench, and you can't put non-Darkness Pokémon into play. (If this Ability stops working, discard Pokémon from your Bench until you have 5.)

attacks.name: Dread End
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Darkness Pokémon in play.

data.name: Dracozolt
data.flavorText: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.

attacks.name: Amping Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Amping Up attack does 90 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Arctozolt
data.flavorText: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

abilities.name: Biting Whirlpool
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

data.name: Polteageist
data.flavorText: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

abilities.name: Tea Break
abilities.text: You must discard a Pokémon that has the Mad Party attack from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Mad Party
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the Mad Party attack.

data.name: Dragapult
data.flavorText: When it isn't battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.

abilities.name: Infiltrator
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Phantom Force
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Galarian Farfetch'd
data.flavorText: The Farfetch'd of the Galar region are brave warriors, and they wield thick, tough leeks in battle.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Galarian Runerigus
data.flavorText: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

attacks.name: Spreading Spite
attacks.text: For each damage counter on this Galarian Runerigus, put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Mad Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Galarian Weezing
data.flavorText: This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.

abilities.name: Neutralizing Gas
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play have no Abilities, except for Neutralizing Gas.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon during Pokémon Checkup.

data.name: Thievul
data.flavorText: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

attacks.name: Thief
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

data.name: Morgrem
data.flavorText: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it's trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.

attacks.name: False Surrender
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Cinccino
data.flavorText: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won't tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

abilities.name: Make Do
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Swanna
data.flavorText: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

abilities.name: Sky Circus
abilities.text: If you played Bird Keeper from your hand during this turn, ignore all Energy in this Pokémon's attack costs.

attacks.name: Feather Slice
attacks.text: You may discard a card from your hand. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Bunnelby
data.flavorText: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

attacks.name: Mad Party
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the Mad Party attack.

data.name: Corvisquire
data.flavorText: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.

attacks.name: Pluck
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Dubwool
data.flavorText: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Rillaboom VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Beating
attacks.text: You may discard up to 3 Grass Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Indeedee V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Watch Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
